content.text: 0) Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
2) In large bowl, combine 1 cup cooked rice, egg, milk, onion, ground beef, salt, and pepper.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "combine"@18:25 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-1 "1 cup cooked rice"@26:43 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "egg"@45:48 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "milk"@50:54 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "onion"@56:61 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "ground beef"@63:74 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-6 "salt"@76:80 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "pepper"@86:92 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-2-0 "large bowl"@6:16 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Place about 1/4 cup of meat mixture in center of each cabbage leaf, and roll up, tucking in ends.
5) In a small bowl, mix together tomato sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "mix"@20:23 / AC
		:loc ( tool-5-0 "a small bowl"@6:18 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( ing-8 "tomato sauce"@33:45 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-9 "brown sugar"@47:58 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-10 "lemon juice"@60:71 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-11 "Worcestershire sauce"@77:97 / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Cover, and cook on low 8 to 9 hours.
